(numLdqEntries, power_switching).explanation: Increasing the number of load queue entries requires more transistors and switching activity in the memory subsystem, directly increasing switching power consumption;

(numLdqEntries, time).explanation: More load queue entries can reduce memory stalls by allowing more outstanding loads, potentially decreasing execution time through improved memory-level parallelism;

(numLdqEntries, cpi).explanation: Additional load queue entries can reduce load-related stalls and improve instruction throughput, directly affecting cycles per instruction;
